subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Anti-Patterns resources
msgSnippet: That s a good list. I would add the Test Smells section from the xUnit Patterns book: http://xunitpatterns.com/Test%20Smells.html (I ve been meaning up
messageBody:
That's a good list. I would add the "Test Smells" section from the xUnit
Patterns book:

http://xunitpatterns.com/Test%20Smells.html

(I've been meaning up update the antipatterns article on Exubero for the
last 2 years to make reference to that. I'm too busy trying to set up a
shoe shop right now. Maybe next year ;-)

Cheers,
Joe

On Wed, August 13, 2008 2:48 pm, howbizrami wrote:
> I'm giving a presentation, and there were the resources I'm using to
> talk about JUnit Anti-Patterns. If anyone has anything else they'd
> recommend I check out, web-based or hardcopy, I would appreciate it.
>
> Thanks :)
>
> http://www.exubero.com/junit/antipatterns.html
> http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/opensource/library/os-junit/
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm
> http://pmd.sourceforge.net/rules/junit.html
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/testinfected/testing.htm
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm
>
>
